history.content: If you are a declared EECS or CS major, you should have cardkey access.

children.subject: Not sure about CS, but EECS majors definitely have (or had) access over the summer. In 2014 when I was here over the summer I wasn't enrolled in any classes but I still had access to Cory, assuming the same was true for Soda s well since they seem to come together. I'm pretty sure you get it as long as you're a student here for EECS, because it doesn't seem to be associated with a class, just the major. We can get a "named" inst account as well that doesn't expire and isn't associated with a class, and pretty sure that comes with the access.

I would be surprised that this is an L&S only thing, but I can confirm that I've lost access to Cory the weekend after finals in 2014 (which was annoying since I needed to grade exams).

Also, according to the WebAcct page that lists your cardkey access, "Cardkeys are automatically enabled for the semester, based on the classes you are in" (emphasis mine).

Yea my guess is it's because of the named accounts (which I don't think L&S CS have access to?) On my list of accounts there's an entry that says EEUGRAD, account typed is named and expires says "not this semester." Access is listed as Cory and Soda Spring 2016, but that changes every term. Since that entry is always in my list, I'm assuming in the summer it just updates to Cory and Soda Summer 2016. Don't know why there's a difference between the two majors though.

Daniel seems to be right. I have a personal account (cs199-...) and the system seems to treat it as another "class" even though I"m not enrolled in cs199 as a class.

There's also this link. https://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~inst/newusers.html Which states that access to Soda/Cory is for "student in EECS/CS major or course"
I hope a staff member can confirm either way rather than having to wait til summer to find out
I am fairly sure LSCS can get access to a named account. You just would have to activate it.

Fairly certain above answer is wrong, considering stuff like this:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/berkeleycs/permalink/662867890474754/

https://www.facebook.com/groups/berkeleycs/permalink/878971318864409

history.content:
I sent a message to inst@eecs to confirm, but in the meantime I found this:

http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/pub/cardkey.help

Edit: Response from inst@eecs: 

Yes, they must be enrolled in a class for the current semester
or summer to get cardkey approval from us.  That includes:

  271, 273, 275, 277, 330, 349 Soda for all CS classes *
  105, 199 Cory for all EE classes *
  200 SDH for CS10 and some DeCals
  111/117, 119, 125, 140, 204, 218 Cory for specific classes

* these are unlocked during business hours, when the buildings
are unlocked

I sent a message to inst@eecs to confirm, but in the meantime I found this:

http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/pub/cardkey.help
Looking into this for you. Stay tuned...

children.subject: Yes, Soda is open during the summer!
Even if I'm not taking CS classes?

Soda Building Access During Summer?
Can CS majors get into Soda during summer?

Key Card Access to Soda

Do declared CS majors get key card access to Soda (even if they aren't enrolled in a CS course?)

history.content:
I'll be living in my apartment in Berkeley this summer since it's close enough to my internship to commute by bart. The apartment is right next to soda, and I like my spending my free time there surfing the web. . Is there any way I can acquire cardkey access over the summer without being enrolled in a class? 

Cory is just as good as well btw.
history.subject: Soda/Cory cardkey access over summer
